title: I am a medical student and now in my fifth year. In order to write a medical paper and get it published, what skills should I master to get me prepared? - Quora

response.answer_text: A2A. You are in fifth year of medicine institute , so you must be attending wards . It's good that you want to publish some articles but what topic ,you intend to publish is most important. Here in india ,to work properly over any research topic and get that work recognised and then published ,at MBBS level is tough and rare. It's not discouragement,rathet a truth . However you may try . Another work can be done is to assess ,study and recgnise rare and challenging cases ,which you may come across and make that case a publishable article . Good Luck !

Our medical students publish papers all the time; you don’t have to take a crash course in laboratory research to do so. Most of their publications involve clinical reports, in collaboration with an attending, such as a chart study on the efficacy of a new drug, a case report of an unusual orthopedic condition, or a rare tumor discovered at surgery. All that is required is to ask to hook up with an attending and them them you want their help in getting you published.
